snippet: America and Iran mustn’t be deluded by false perceptions. If both believe they have the upper hand in negotiations, there will be no nuclear deal.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Iranian scholars Seyed Hossein Mousavian and Mohammad Ali Shabani asserts that election of Hassan Rouhani as Iran's president offers Obama administration a once-in-a-lifetime chance to end atomic stalemate with Iran; warns against embracing misguided perceptions about each side's strengths and weaknesses, saying that is biggest threat to negotiations.

byline.original: By SEYED HOSSEIN MOUSAVIAN and MOHAMMAD ALI SHABANI

lead_paragraph: America and Iran mustn’t be deluded by false perceptions. If both believe they have the upper hand in negotiations, there will be no nuclear deal.

headline.main: How to End the Stalemate With Iran
headline.print_headline: How to End the Stalemate With Iran
